title: Ful Medames with Olive Oil, Salt, and Cumin
cooking_steps: 1. Soak and boil 2 cups fava beans until soft (or use canned). 2. Mash lightly, add 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp cumin, juice of 1 lemon, and 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Heat for 5 min. Serve with bread.
healthier_alternative: Use less olive oil or vegetable broth
cheaper_alternative: Use sunflower oil instead of olive oil

title: Ful Medames with Lemon and Chili
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, add 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp salt, 2 tbsp lemon juice, and 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Heat for 5 min. Serve with flatbread.
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of olive oil

title: Ful Medames with Paprika and Fresh Herbs
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, mix in 1 tsp paprika, 0.25 cup parsley, 0.25 cup coriander, and 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Heat for 5 min. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use dried herbs instead of fresh

title: Ful Medames with Butter and Garlic
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Sauté 3 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp butter. 3. Mash beans, add garlic-butter, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 tsp salt. Heat for 5 min. Serve with pita.
healthier_alternative: Use olive oil instead of butter

title: Ful Medames with Ghee and Cumin
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, add 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp salt, juice of 1 lemon, and 2 tbsp melted ghee. 3. Heat for 5 min. Serve with bread.
healthier_alternative: Use olive oil instead of ghee
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of ghee

title: Ful Medames with Linseed Oil and Onions
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Sauté 1 sliced onion in 2 tbsp linseed oil until golden. 3. Mash beans, add onions, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 tsp salt. Heat for 5 min. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of linseed oil

title: Ful Medames Topped with Diced Tomatoes and Cucumbers
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, add juice of 1 lemon and 2 tbsp olive oil. Heat for 5 min. 3. Top with 2 diced tomatoes and 1 diced cucumber. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Omit olive oil, use lemon juice only

title: Ful Medames with Fried Egg and Tahini
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, add 1 tsp cumin and 2 tbsp tahini. Heat for 5 min. 3. Fry 2 eggs in 1 tbsp olive oil. Top beans with eggs. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use boiled eggs instead of fried

title: Ful Medames with Boiled Egg and Roomi Cheese
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Boil 2 eggs, peel, and slice. 3. Mash beans, add 1 tsp salt and 2 tbsp olive oil. Heat for 5 min. 4. Top with eggs and 0.25 cup Roomi cheese. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use feta instead of Roomi cheese

title: Ful Medames with Omelet and Sujuk
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Sauté 100 g sujuk and 2 minced garlic cloves in 1 tbsp olive oil. 3. Beat 3 eggs, add to sujuk, and cook omelet. 4. Mash beans, add 1 tbsp olive oil, heat for 5 min. Top with omelet. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use minced beef instead of sujuk

title: Ful Medames with Pastirma and Garlic-Vinegar Sauce
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mix 2 minced garlic cloves, 2 tbsp vinegar, and 1 tbsp olive oil for sauce. 3. Mash beans, add 1 tbsp olive oil, heat for 5 min. 4. Top with 100 g pastirma and sauce. Serve with bread.

title: Alexandrian Ful Medames (Spicy with Peppers)
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Sauté 1 chopped green pepper and 2 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Mash beans, add pepper-garlic mix and 1 tsp chili powder. Heat for 5 min. Serve with bread.

title: Sa'eedi Ful Medames (Rich Broth with Tomato)
cooking_steps: 1. Simmer 2 cups fava beans in water to make broth. 2. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 chopped tomatoes in 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Add to beans with 1 tsp cumin. Simmer 10 min. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of olive oil

title: Damietta Ful Medames with Yogurt
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, add 1 tsp salt, heat for 5 min. 3. Mix 0.5 cup yogurt, 2 minced garlic cloves, and juice of 1 lemon. 4. Top beans with yogurt mix. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use laban rayeb instead of yogurt

title: Ful Medames with Pomegranate Seeds and Mint
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Mash, add juice of 1 lemon and 2 tbsp olive oil. Heat for 5 min. 3. Top with 0.25 cup pomegranate seeds and 0.25 cup chopped mint. Serve with bread.

title: Lentil Soup (Shorbet Ads) with Carrots and Cumin
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 chopped carrots in 2 tbsp olive oil. 2. Add 1 cup lentils and 4 cups water. Simmer 30–40 min. 3. Add 1 tsp cumin and salt. Blend if desired. Serve hot.
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of olive oil

title: Spicy Lentil Soup with Chili and Lemon
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 1 cup lentils, 1 tsp chili powder, and 4 cups water. Simmer 30–40 min. 3. Add juice of 1 lemon and salt. Serve hot.
cheaper_alternative: Use chili flakes instead of powder

title: Creamy Lentil Soup with Coconut Milk
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 1 cup lentils, 1 tsp cumin, and 3 cups water. Simmer 30 min. 3. Add 1 cup coconut milk, simmer 10 min. Blend until creamy. Serve hot.
cheaper_alternative: Use milk instead of coconut milk

title: Koshary with Tomato-Garlic Sauce and Crispy Onions
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 0.5 cup lentils and 0.5 cup rice separately. 2. Cook 1 cup macaroni until al dente. 3. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 3 chopped tomatoes for sauce. 4. Fry 1 sliced onion until crispy. 5. Layer lentils, rice, macaroni, sauce, and crispy onions. Serve hot.

title: Koshary with Harissa and Yogurt Sauce
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 0.5 cup lentils and 0.5 cup rice separately. 2. Cook 1 cup macaroni until al dente. 3. Mix 0.5 cup yogurt with 1 tbsp harissa for sauce. 4. Layer lentils, rice, macaroni, and top with sauce. Serve immediately.

title: Koshary with Smoked Paprika and Black Lentils
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 0.5 cup black lentils and 0.5 cup rice separately. 2. Cook 1 cup macaroni until al dente. 3. Fry 2 sliced onions until crispy. 4. Toss lentils with 1 tsp smoked paprika. 5. Layer lentils, rice, macaroni, and top with onions. Serve hot.

title: Ads bi Hamod (Lentils with Lemon and Garlic)
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 1 cup lentils in 4 cups water for 30–40 min. 2. Sauté 3 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Add garlic, juice of 1 lemon, and 1 tsp salt to lentils. Simmer 5 min. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of olive oil

title: Bissara (Fava Bean Dip) with Dill and Olive Oil
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans until soft. 2. Blend with 2 minced garlic cloves, juice of 1 lemon, and 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Stir in 0.25 cup chopped dill. Serve with bread.
cheaper_alternative: Use vegetable oil instead of olive oil

title: Bissara with Smoked Salt and Mint
cooking_steps: 1. Cook 2 cups fava beans. 2. Blend with 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 tsp smoked salt, and 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Stir in 0.25 cup chopped mint. Serve with bread.

title: Rice with Vermicelli (Roz bil Sha'areya)
cooking_steps: 1. Toast 0.5 cup vermicelli in 2 tbsp melted butter until golden. 2. Add 1 cup rice, 1 tsp salt, and 2 cups water. 3. Simmer 15–20 min until cooked. Fluff and serve.
healthier_alternative: Use olive oil instead of butter

title: Waraq Enab (Grape Leaves) with Rice and Herbs
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch 30 grape leaves. 2. Mix 1 cup rice, 0.5 cup parsley, 0.25 cup dill, and 1 chopped tomato. 3. Roll 1 tbsp filling in each leaf. 4. Simmer in pot with water for 45–60 min. Serve with yogurt.

title: Waraq Enab with Rice, Minced Meat, and Dill
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch 30 grape leaves. 2. Mix 0.5 cup rice, 200 g minced beef, 0.25 cup dill, and 1 chopped tomato. 3. Roll 1 tbsp filling in each leaf. 4. Simmer in pot with water for 45–60 min. Serve with yogurt.

title: Waraq Enab in Tagine with Lamb Chops
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch 30 grape leaves. 2. Mix 0.5 cup rice, 1 chopped tomato, and 2 minced garlic cloves. 3. Roll 1 tbsp filling in each leaf. 4. Sear 400 g lamb chops, add rolls and 1 chopped tomato. Simmer in tagine with water for 1 hr. Serve hot.

title: Kromb (Cabbage Leaves) with Spiced Rice and Tomato Sauce
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch 20 cabbage leaves. 2. Mix 1 cup rice, 1 chopped onion, and 1 tsp cumin. 3. Roll 1 tbsp filling in each leaf. 4. Cook 2 chopped tomatoes into sauce. 5. Simmer rolls in sauce with water for 45 min. Serve hot.

title: Koosa (Zucchini) Stuffed with Rice, Mint, and Lemon
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 zucchini. 2. Mix 1 cup rice, 0.25 cup mint, juice of 1 lemon, and 1 tbsp olive oil. 3. Stuff zucchini. 4. Simmer in pot with 1 tbsp olive oil and water for 40–50 min. Serve with lemon.

title: Koosa Stuffed with Bulgur and Chickpeas
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 zucchini. 2. Mix 0.5 cup bulgur, 0.5 cup chickpeas, 1 chopped onion, and 0.25 cup parsley. 3. Stuff zucchini. 4. Simmer in pot with water for 40–50 min. Serve with yogurt.

title: Batenjan (Eggplant) Stuffed with Rice and Pine Nuts
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 eggplants. 2. Toast 0.25 cup pine nuts. 3. Mix 1 cup rice, pine nuts, 1 chopped tomato, and 2 minced garlic cloves. 4. Stuff eggplants. 5. Simmer with water for 40–50 min. Serve hot.
cheaper_alternative: Use sunflower seeds instead of pine nuts

title: Felfel (Bell Peppers) Stuffed with Rice, Beef, and Allspice
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 bell peppers. 2. Mix 0.5 cup rice, 200 g minced beef, 1 chopped tomato, and 1 tsp allspice. 3. Stuff peppers. 4. Simmer with water for 40–50 min. Serve with tomato sauce.

title: Tamatem (Tomatoes) Stuffed with Rice and Parsley
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 6 tomatoes, reserve flesh. 2. Mix 1 cup rice, 0.25 cup parsley, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp olive oil. 3. Stuff tomatoes. 4. Simmer with tomato flesh, 1 tbsp olive oil, and water for 40 min. Serve warm.

title: Batates (Potatoes) Stuffed with Minced Meat and Onions
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 potatoes. 2. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 200 g minced beef, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 chopped tomato. 3. Stuff potatoes. 4. Simmer with water for 40–50 min. Serve hot.

title: Mixed Mahshi Platter (Zucchini, Peppers, Grape Leaves)
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 2 zucchini and 2 bell peppers
tags: blanch 15 grape leaves. 2. Mix 1 cup rice and 0.25 cup parsley. 3. Stuff vegetables and roll leaves. 4. Simmer in pot with water for 45–60 min. Serve with yogurt.

title: Mahshi with Saffron Rice and Almonds
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch 30 grape leaves. 2. Mix 1 cup rice, 0.25 tsp saffron (soaked in water), 0.25 cup almonds, and juice of 1 lemon. 3. Roll 1 tbsp filling in each leaf. 4. Simmer with water for 45–60 min. Serve with lemon.
cheaper_alternative: Use sunflower seeds instead of almonds

title: Torly with Potatoes, Carrots, and Peas
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 2 cubed potatoes, 2 sliced carrots, 0.5 cup peas, and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Torly with Okra and Lamb
cooking_steps: 1. Sear 400 g lamb in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 2 minced garlic cloves and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Stir in 500 g okra and 2 tbsp coriander. 4. Simmer with 1 cup water for 30–40 min. Serve with rice.

title: Torly with Zucchini and Eggplant (Summer Variation)
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 2 sliced zucchini, 1 cubed eggplant, and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Bamia (Okra Stew) with Lamb and Tomato
cooking_steps: 1. Sear 400 g lamb in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 3 minced garlic cloves and 3 chopped tomatoes. 3. Stir in 500 g okra and 2 tbsp coriander. 4. Simmer with 1 cup water for 30–40 min. Serve with rice.

title: Bamia with Garlic and Coriander
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 3 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp olive oil. 2. Add 500 g okra and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water and 2 tbsp coriander for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Vegetarian Bamia with Chickpeas
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 500 g okra, 2 chopped tomatoes, and 0.5 cup chickpeas. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Molokhia with Chicken and Garlic
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 500 g chicken in 4 cups water
tags: shred and reserve broth. 2. Add 500 g molokhia to broth, simmer 10 min. 3. Sauté 5 minced garlic cloves and 2 tbsp coriander in 2 tbsp butter. 4. Add to molokhia, simmer 5 min. Serve with chicken and rice.

title: Molokhia with Rabbit and Lemon
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 500 g rabbit in 4 cups water
tags: shred and reserve broth. 2. Add 500 g molokhia to broth, simmer 10 min. 3. Sauté 3 minced garlic cloves and 2 tbsp coriander in 1 tbsp oil. 4. Add garlic mix and juice of 1 lemon to molokhia. Serve with rabbit and rice.

title: Alexandrian Molokhia with Shrimp
cooking_steps: 1. Simmer 500 g molokhia in 3 cups water for 10 min. 2. Sauté 300 g shrimp, 3 minced garlic cloves, and 2 tbsp coriander in 1 tbsp oil. 3. Add shrimp mix and juice of 1 lemon to molokhia. Simmer 5 min. Serve with rice.

title: Molokhia with Beef and Roasted Garlic
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 400 g beef in 4 cups water
tags: reserve broth. 2. Roast 5 garlic cloves at 400°F (200°C) for 15 min, mince. 3. Add 500 g molokhia to broth, simmer 10 min. 4. Sauté roasted garlic and 2 tbsp coriander in 2 tbsp butter. Add to molokhia. Serve with beef and rice.

title: Mesaka'a (Egyptian Moussaka) with Minced Meat and Tomato
cooking_steps: 1. Salt and fry 2 sliced eggplants. 2. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 300 g minced beef. 3. Add 3 chopped tomatoes, cook 10 min. 4. Layer eggplant and meat sauce in dish. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Vegetarian Mesaka'a with Chickpeas
cooking_steps: 1. Salt and fry 2 sliced eggplants. 2. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 3 chopped tomatoes. 3. Add 0.5 cup chickpeas, cook 5 min. 4. Layer eggplant and chickpea sauce. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 min. Serve with rice.

title: Sabanegh (Spinach Stew) with Ground Beef and Rice
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 300 g ground beef. 2. Add 500 g spinach, cook until wilted. 3. Add 0.5 cup rice and 2 cups water, simmer 20–25 min. Serve with bread.

title: Sabanegh with Chickpeas and Lemon
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves. 2. Add 500 g spinach until wilted. 3. Add 0.5 cup chickpeas and juice of 1 lemon, simmer 10 min. Serve with bread.

title: Qolqas (Taro Root Stew) with Swiss Chard and Garlic
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 3 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp olive oil. 2. Add 500 g taro and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Add 200 g Swiss chard and 1 cup water, simmer 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Qolqas with Lamb and Coriander
cooking_steps: 1. Sear 400 g lamb. 2. Add 2 minced garlic cloves and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Add 500 g taro, 2 tbsp coriander, and 1 cup water, simmer 30–40 min. Serve with rice.

title: Basella (Pea and Carrot Stew) with Chicken
cooking_steps: 1. Sear 400 g chicken with 1 chopped onion. 2. Add 2 sliced carrots, 0.5 cup peas, and 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 30–40 min. Serve with rice.

title: Batates Mahshi (Stuffed Potatoes) with Spiced Beef
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 potatoes. 2. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 300 g minced beef, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 chopped tomato. 3. Stuff potatoes. 4. Simmer with water for 40–50 min. Serve hot.

title: Batates bi Laban (Potatoes in Yogurt Sauce)
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 4 cubed potatoes until tender. 2. Sauté 2 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Mix garlic with 0.5 cup yogurt and juice of 1 lemon. 4. Toss potatoes in sauce. Serve warm.

title: Grilled Vegetable Platter with Tahini
cooking_steps: 1. Grill 2 sliced zucchini, 1 sliced eggplant, and 2 sliced bell peppers for 5 min per side. 2. Mix 0.25 cup tahini with juice of 1 lemon and 2 tbsp water. 3. Drizzle over vegetables. Serve on platter.

title: Stuffed Artichokes with Rice and Dill
cooking_steps: 1. Trim 4 artichokes, remove choke. 2. Mix 0.5 cup rice, 0.25 cup dill, juice of 1 lemon, and 1 tbsp olive oil. 3. Stuff artichokes. 4. Simmer with 1 tbsp olive oil and water for 40–50 min. Serve warm.

title: Mahshi Lift (Turnips) with Rice and Parsley
cooking_steps: 1. Hollow out 4 turnips. 2. Mix 0.5 cup rice, 0.25 cup parsley, juice of 1 lemon, and 1 tbsp olive oil. 3. Stuff turnips. 4. Simmer with 1 tbsp olive oil and water for 40–50 min. Serve with lemon.

title: Mahshi with Pomegranate Molasses Glaze
cooking_steps: 1. Blanch 30 grape leaves. 2. Mix 1 cup rice, 0.25 cup parsley, 1 chopped tomato, and 1 tbsp pomegranate molasses. 3. Roll 1 tbsp filling in each leaf. 4. Simmer with 1 tbsp pomegranate molasses and water for 45–60 min. Serve with yogurt.
cheaper_alternative: Use lemon juice instead of molasses

title: Torly with Fennel and Leeks
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 2 sliced fennel, 2 sliced leeks, and 2 minced garlic cloves in 2 tbsp olive oil. 2. Add 2 chopped tomatoes. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.

title: Bamia with Tamarind and Chili
cooking_steps: 1. Sauté 2 minced garlic cloves and 2 chopped tomatoes in 1 tbsp oil. 2. Add 500 g okra, 1 tbsp tamarind paste, and 1 tsp chili powder. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 20–25 min. Serve with rice.
cheaper_alternative: Use lemon juice instead of tamarind

title: Molokhia with Duck and Green Peppercorns
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 500 g duck in 4 cups water
tags: shred and reserve broth. 2. Add 500 g molokhia to broth, simmer 10 min. 3. Sauté 3 minced garlic cloves, 2 tbsp coriander, and 1 tsp green peppercorns in 1 tbsp oil. 4. Add to molokhia, simmer 5 min. Serve with duck and rice.

title: Mesaka'a with Cauliflower and Tomato
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 1 head cauliflower florets for 5 min. 2. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 3 chopped tomatoes in 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Layer cauliflower and sauce in dish. 4. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 min. Serve with rice.

title: Sabanegh with Lentils and Caramelized Onions
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 0.5 cup lentils for 20 min. 2. Caramelize 2 sliced onions in 2 tbsp olive oil. 3. Sauté 500 g spinach and 2 minced garlic cloves until wilted. 4. Add lentils, cook 5 min. Top with onions. Serve with bread.

title: Grilled Kofta with Parsley and Onion
cooking_steps: 1. Mix 500 g ground beef, 0.5 cup parsley, 1 grated onion, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 tsp salt. 2. Form into patties. 3. Grill 4–5 min per side. Serve with pita.

title: Baked Kofta in Tomato Sauce with Potatoes
cooking_steps: 1. Mix 500 g ground beef, 1 chopped onion, and 2 minced garlic cloves
tags: form patties. 2. Cook 3 chopped tomatoes into sauce. 3. Layer 2 sliced potatoes and kofta in dish, pour sauce over. 4. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30–40 min. Serve with rice.

title: Kofta with Tahini and Pine Nuts
cooking_steps: 1. Mix 500 g ground beef, 1 grated onion, and 1 tsp cumin
tags: form patties. 2. Toast 0.25 cup pine nuts. 3. Grill kofta 4–5 min per side. 4. Mix 0.25 cup tahini with 2 tbsp water. Top kofta with tahini and pine nuts. Serve with pita.

title: Kebab Halla (Braised Beef) with Onions and Spices
cooking_steps: 1. Sear 500 g beef cubes. 2. Add 2 sliced onions, 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 chopped tomato. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 1.5–2 hr. Serve with rice.

title: Grilled Lamb Kebabs with Mint and Garlic
cooking_steps: 1. Marinate 500 g lamb with 0.25 cup mint, 3 minced garlic cloves, 2 tbsp olive oil, and juice of 1 lemon for 1 hr. 2. Skewer and grill 4–5 min per side. Serve with pita.

title: Chicken Pane (Breaded Chicken Cutlets)
cooking_steps: 1. Slice 500 g chicken into cutlets. 2. Dredge in 0.5 cup flour, dip in 2 beaten eggs, coat with 1 cup breadcrumbs. 3. Fry in 0.5 cup oil 3–4 min per side. Serve with salad.

title: Roasted Chicken with Rosemary and Lemon
cooking_steps: 1. Rub 1 kg chicken with 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp rosemary, 3 minced garlic cloves, and juice of 1 lemon. 2. Roast with 1 sliced lemon at 375°F (190°C) for 1–1.5 hr. Serve with vegetables.

title: Chicken Tagine with Olives and Preserved Lemon
cooking_steps: 1. Sear 500 g chicken. 2. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, 0.5 cup olives, and 1 chopped preserved lemon. 3. Simmer with 1 cup water for 40–50 min. Serve with couscous.
cheaper_alternative: Use fresh lemon instead of preserved

title: Fatta with Lamb and Garlic-Yogurt Sauce
cooking_steps: 1. Boil 400 g lamb
tags: reserve broth. 2. Toast 2 pieces torn bread. 3. Cook 2 chopped tomatoes into sauce. 4. Mix 0.5 cup yogurt with 2 minced garlic cloves. 5. Layer bread, lamb, tomato sauce, and yogurt sauce. Serve immediately.

title: Vegetarian Fatta with Chickpeas and Crispy Bread
cooking_steps: 1. Heat 1 cup chickpeas in 1 cup water. 2. Toast 2 pieces torn bread. 3. Cook 2 chopped tomatoes into sauce. 4. Mix 0.5 cup yogurt with 2 minced garlic cloves. 5. Layer bread, chickpeas, tomato sauce, and yogurt sauce. Serve immediately.
